briefTitle: An Efficacy and Safety Study of Desloratadine (MK-4117) in Japanese Participants With Chronic Urticaria (MK-4117-201)
officialTitle: A Phase III Multicentre, Parallel-group, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Double-blind Clinical Trial to Study the Efficacy and Safety of MK-4117 in Japanese Subjects With Chronic Urticaria.
summary: This is a study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of desloratadine (MK-4117) in Japanese participants with chronic urticaria. The primary hypothesis is that the efficacy of desloratadine 10 mg and 5 mg is superior to placebo as based on the change from Baseline in the sum score of pruritus/itch and rash as assessed by the Investigator at Week 2.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Sum Score of Pruritus/Itch and Rash Assessed by Investigator at Week 2
